question: What should I do if my phone charger isn't working?
option1: Use a toothpick to clean out all the ports and holes in the phone, it is clogged.

question: To keep your vacuum cleaner in excellent condition,
option1: empty the dirt after each use. Also, wash the filter and clean the hoses on a monthly basis.
option2: empty the dirt after each use.  Also, wash the filter and clean the hoses on a yearly basis.

question: How to quickly remove the pit from an avocado?
option1: Slice the avocado in half and chop down on the pit with a knife then raise the knife to dislodge the pit
option2: Slice the avocado in half and chop down on the flesh with a knife then peel away the flesh of the avocado

question: how do you win at chess?
What is an easy way to make a baby quilt without cutting a lot pieces to be sown together?
option1: Cut 2 matching pieces of material and 1 if batting with scissors, sandwich the batting with the print materials placing print sides in, sew a line 1" from the edge all the way around, then fold edges in and sew around the edges again, and then sew in circular motions all over the quilt and cut strings off when done.
option2: Cut 2 matching pieces of material and 1 if batting with scissors, sandwich the batting with the print materials placing print sides out, sew a line 1" from the edge all the way around, then fold edges in and sew around the edges again, and then sew in circular motions all over the quilt and cut strings off when done.

question: How can you keep swimming goggles cleaner longer?
option1: Wipe a smear of sulphuric acid on the inside of the goggles, then wipe it off, it will keep them cleaner longer.
option2: Wipe a smear of toothpaste on the inside of the goggles, then wipe it off, it will keep them cleaner longer.

question: Repel ants from pet food.
option1: Apply honey in circle around pet food.
option2: Apply vaseline in circle around pet food.

question: Steps to make electricity from fire.
option1: Take the bigger sink and spread evenly the oil grease using something flat, attach the COLD SIDE of the Peltier Cell to it (the side with the writes on), spread more Thermal paste on the HOT SIDE of the cell, attach the small sink to it, I used some heat resistant tubes to protect the wires from the heat and a couple of M3 40mm bolts to fix everything in place, I made a quick test with a propane torch to see if the prototype is working, With a cylindrical Steel can I made the brazier, measure the top sink (in my case is 40mm) and cut the shape on the bottom of it using an electrical tool, If everything fit right move on, use a water container to allow the cooling to be more effective than air, pour enough water to cover the sink, but beware of touching the Peltier Cell and start the fire.
option2: Take the bigger heatsink and spread evenly the Thermal grease using something flat, attach the COLD SIDE of the Peltier Cell to it (the side with the writes on), spread more Thermal paste on the HOT SIDE of the cell, attach the small heatsink to it, I used some heat resistant tubes to protect the wires from the heat and a couple of M3 40mm bolts to fix everything in place, I made a quick test with a propane torch to see if the prototype is working, With a cylindrical Steel can I made the brazier, measure the top heatsink (in my case is 40mm) and cut the shape on the bottom of it using an electrical tool, If everything fit right move on, use a water container to allow the cooling to be more effective than air, pour enough water to cover the sink, but beware of touching the Peltier Cell and start the fire.

option2: Divide the risen dough to 16 pieces with a knife
